EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Steam Power Generation System (Boiler Zone) at (8.0, 20.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Boiler at (8.0, 20.5)  
 – Role: Produces steam fueled by coal.  
 – Status: WORKING; Fuel: {'coal': 8}.
• Extra Steam Engine at (11.5, 18.5)  
 – Role: Converts steam to electrical energy.  
 – Status: NOT_CONNECTED; Energy: 0.0.
• Offshore Pump at (1.5, 32.5)  
 – Role: Supplies water to the boiler.  
 – Status: WORKING; Connected to the boiler via a pipe group (24 pipes were used).

### Iron Ore Mining Operation at (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of the following entities:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0)  
 – Function: Extracts iron ore.  
 – Status: WORKING; Fuel: {'coal': 7}; Energy produced: 2666.67; Drop position: (-14.5, -48.5).
• Belt Group at (-14.5, -48.5)  
 – Details: Connects input from a belt at (-14.5, -485) to output at (-9.5, -46.5).  
 – Status: WORKING; Inventory: {'iron-ore': 1}; Composed of 8 belts.
• Belt Group at (-16.5, -47.5)  
 – Details: Connects input from a belt at (-16.5, -47.5) to output at (-15.5, -48.5).  
 – Status: WORKING; Inventory: {'iron-ore': 11}; Composed of 3 belts.
• Wooden Chest at (-15.5, -44.5)  
 – Role: Acts as a storage container for ore collection near the Burner Mining Drill’s drop point.  
 – Status: NORMAL.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Wooden Chest Placement Positioning  
 – Ensure the player is moved near the target drop position before attempting placement to avoid range-related errors.
• Wooden Chest Obstruction & Placement Failures  
 – Before placing a wooden chest, verify that the target area is clear of other objects.  
 – If a placement fails due to an obstruction (e.g. “Could not find a suitable position…”), perform an offset search or expand the search parameters.  
 – When automated searches (iterative or extended) fail, inspect and manually clear nearby obstructions.
• Buildable Area Property Access  
 – Access buildable_area.center as a property (without parentheses) to prevent TypeError issues.
• Retained Error Practices  
 – Pipe Connection: Confirm connection points are unobstructed and that sufficient pipes are available.  
 – Inventory and Placement: Always validate the presence of the required entity and available space prior to placement.  
 – Crafting Ingredients: Verify all sub-ingredients are available when initiating a craft.  
 – Entity Retrieval: Search within an appropriate radius if an expected entity is missing.  
 – Attribute Access: Use direct property access rather than calling properties as functions.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────────
get_connection_amount(boiler: Entity, extra_se: Entity, connection_type: Prototype) -> int  
 – Determines the required number of pipes to connect two entities; raises an exception if connectivity or spatial conditions are not met.

place_entity(entity_type: Prototype, position: Position, direction: Direction) -> Entity  
 – Attempts to place an entity of the specified type at the given position and orientation; fails if the tile is occupied or if the necessary item is absent from inventory.

craft_item(item: Prototype, quantity: int) -> int  
 – Initiates crafting for a specified item and quantity; throws an exception if essential sub-ingredients or an operational production/smelting facility is missing.

Important Variables:
• inventory: dict[str, int] — Represents the current inventory.
• boiler: Entity — Refers to the boiler at (8.0, 20.5).
• extra_se: Entity — Denotes the extra steam engine at (11.5, 18.5).
• new_buildable_area: BuildableArea — Utility used to determine available buildable regions.
